During this time the temperature of the gas is unchanged.

[t]Star | Distance from Earth (light-years) | Approximate surface temperature (K) | Age (years)
Sirius A | 8.6 | 9900 | 2.4 x 10⁸
Polaris | 430 | 6000 | 7.0 x 10⁷

Rigel | 860 | 11000 | 8.0 x 10⁶
VY Canis Majoris | 3900 | 3500 | 1.0 x 10⁷[/t]

[s]I As the distance from Earth increases, the age of a star decreases.

question_text:
A car is parked in the sun for some time.
During this time the air pressure inside the tyres increases.

The reason for this increase in pressure is
option_a: the volume occupied by the air particles in the tyres has increased
option_b: the force produced by the air particles in the tyres acts over a smaller area
option_c: the average spacing between the air particles in the tyres has increased
option_d: the increased temperature has made the air particles in the tyres expand
option_e: the air particles in the tyres are moving with greater kinetic energy
